newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian bank robberies hit record, hauls shrink.
newsitem.headline: Belgian bank robberies hit record, hauls shrink.

text.p: Belgium had a record year for bank hold-ups in 1996, although the average haul fell sharply, the Belgian Banking Association said Monday.
The number of bank hold-ups throughout the country rose to 278 last year from 267 in 1995 -- itself a record.
But the average haul fell to 390,000 francs ($10,260) from 574,000 francs ($15,100).
The vast majority of the hold-ups took place in the late morning at the end of the week, and involved two attackers with a third keeping watch.
As in 1995, there were 82 bank break-ins, mostly on weekend nights. The average haul was 72,500 francs ($1,900).
